item.title: Lenovo issues global recall for Thinkpad batteries
item.description: Lenovo has expanded a battery recall that was first announced on March 27, 2014. This recall now includes all affected lithium-ion batteries globally. The batteries, as announced in late April 2015, were manufactured for ThinkPad notebook computers shipped between February 2010 and June 2012. Lenovo stated that they are offering free-of-charge replacement batteries for all recalled batteries in the interest of public safety. item.title: There is currently a blanket flight ban for the Samsung Note7, and the issue of owners currently overseas has not been addressed
item.description: Airlines across the Asia Pacific and Middle East regions are mirroring a ban started by the US Department of Transportation (DOT), the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), and the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA). The US ban prohibits all Samsung Galaxy Note7 smartphones from air travel. This restriction was announced on October 14th (October 15th, Singapore time) and went into effect at noon, eastern time on October 15th (October 16th, Singapore time).

item.title: Apple is recalling Beats speakers and offering refunds
item.description: Apple initiated a voluntary recall of Beats Pill XL speakers due to a potential fire safety risk. The company determined that in rare cases, the battery in these speakers may overheat. This recall only affects the specific Beats Pill XL speaker model shown in the images and no other Beats or Apple products. Apple prioritizes customer safety and urges all Beats Pill XL users to stop using their devices. item.title: UMW Toyota Motor has expanded its Special Service Campaign to include almost 30,000 cars in Malaysia
item.description: Toyota Motor Corporation (TMC) issued global recalls related to airbag inflators in some vehicle models on April 11, 2013, and May 13, 2015, and expanded the recall on June 25, 2015. Responding to this, UMW Toyota Motor is expanding its Special Service Campaign in Malaysia. UMW Toyota Motor has confirmed with TMC that this campaign affects 29,985 Toyota Vios, Corolla Altis, and Yaris models manufactured between April 2007, and December 2008.
